reviewText: This pokemon video was alot better than some other pokemon videos I have seen before. Only, I wish they would bring the subbed version of Pokemon to America. I get tired of hearing Misty's voice in English.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Agreeing with other reviews I'd have to say that Pokemon is a good show but it seems that now even adults have noticed the topic has lost a lot of intrest. The first few two seasons are great! But just think about this. The 4Kids and the WB are going to try and release every episode on DVD, I am not sure but it seems like they would. Anyway you are going to have to pay $20 for each of these dvd's which ONLY contain 3 episodes each. Most anime DVD's start off with atleast 4 on each and then go down to 3 after getting so far into the series of the show. There are much more than 100 episodes of Pokemon. And I really don't think the show is going to be ending any time soon. There are 4 seasons so far: Indigo League, Orange League, Johto Journey, and Johto League Champion. But everyone knows that the first season could make up two seasons because of how long it was. I'm NOT putting down the show at all. I'm just saying that it would better if you have already seen the episodes to just wait for re runs because for right now the DVD's would be too expensive. If we are lucky MAYBE they'll one day make box sets. Of course there would have to be many of them but I'd wrather buy a box set for cheaper than have to buy one DVD at a time. So if you've got the money go ahead and buy them but otherwise wait until their prices lower. I guarantee you that Pokemon will be around for a long time so you don't have to buying the DVD's the day they come out.
summary: Good shows but not worth the cost

reviewText: When I first started watching the TV series I thought that it was really uniqu. And I was right. Infact in the beginning it was a different kind of show. The thing that really get's me up is when it started in japan from a  popular program called "Pocket Monsters". The series is awsome.  It has nice characters, nice creatures, nice action, and more. Not 1, not  2, not 3, not 4, but totally 5 stars for this cool action series!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this for my 4 1/2 year old son for Christmas, since he is a big fan of Pokemon, and he LOVES this!  He sits through the entire thing from beginning to end, and anyone with young kids knows how amazing that is!  The episodes are actually interesting, I actually found myself watching them with him and not getting bored!  If you have a child that loves Pokemon or Pikachu, I recommend this DVD highly!
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Jules Carrozza, the Japanese film king
reviewText: This is the first three Pokemon episodes. Ash Ketchum of Pallet Town oversleeps on his day to get his first Pokemon and gets stuck with the rebelious Pikachu instead of Charmander, Bulbasaur, or Squirtle. Team  Rocket makes theoir first appearances in the second episode. They went from  being villians in this episode to absoulte idiots. They should just abandon  trying to catch Pikachu and do something else. And Misty is the meanest  girl I've ever seen. Japanese anime fans may enjoy, but this is  lighthearted stuff. However, I like this show very much! I really want to  see the uncut Japanese episodes! This should be exported subtitled.
summary: A good video, but this should be subtitled.

reviewText: There are some great tales in the early Pokemon series I'll probably always remember watching when I was about five or six, and this is what started my spark for loving Pokemon. (When I was seven, I had almost nine hundred Pokemon cards!) Now I'm 11, and I hate it that Pokemon has changed so much. Ash, Brock and Misty rocked just as that threesome, but later they put in that guy to replce Brock... was it Derek or something?? (Someone please correct me or I'll never sleep!) But, I'm trying to get all the earlier TV shhows on DVD, and this is the first I got. But, don't listen to me blabbering. If you're a Pokemon geek, get this DVD!
summary: This is great! Too bad they ruined it near 2004 though...
